question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
I run at a constant pace, and it takes me 18 minutes to run to the store from my house. If the store is 2 miles away, and my friend's house is 1 mile away from my house, how many minutes will it take me to run from my house to my friend's house?
inference:
Calculate the speed in miles per minute:
Speed = Distance / Time
Speed = 2 miles / 18 minutes
Speed = 1/9 miles/minute
Calculate the time to run from my house to my friend's house:
Time = Distance / Speed
Time = 1 mile / (1/9 miles/minute)
Time = 9 minutes
Final Answer: \boxed{9}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Since I run at a constant pace, we can set up a proportion with one unknown: \begin{align*}
\frac{\text{minutes}}{\text{distance}}&=\frac{\text{minutes}}{\text{distance}}\\
\frac{x}{1\text{ mi}}&=\frac{18\text{ min}}{2\text{ mi}}\\
x&=\frac{18\text{ min}}{2\text{ mi}}\cdot 1\text{ mi}\\
x&=\frac{18\text{ min}}{2}=9\text{ min}\\
x&=\boxed{9\text{ min}}.
\end{align*}
